etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "tree") + 婁(婁) (lóu, phonetic) = wooden structure -> large building -> 樓(樓) (lóu, "tower")
etymology.interpretation: The character 樓(樓) (lóu, "tower") combines the semantic 木(木) (mù, "tree") signifying wooden structures and the phonetic 婁(婁) (lóu) to suggest a large wooden building. This compound character conveys the image of a building with multiple floors, typically incorporating timber in its construction.
etymology.simplification: 樓(樓) was simplified to 楼(楼) by replacing 婁(婁) with 娄(娄), which retains the phonetic component but reduces the number of strokes.

examples.chinese: 那座楼很高(那座樓很高)。
我住在高楼(我住在高樓)，每天欣赏美景(每天欣賞美景)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài gāo lóu, měitiān xīnshǎng měijǐng.
examples.english: I live in a tall building, and every day I admire the beautiful scenery.

examples.chinese: 那座古楼是城市的标志(那座古樓是城市的標誌)。
examples.pinyin: Nà zuò gǔ lóu shì chéngshì de biāozhì.
examples.english: That ancient building is the symbol of the city.
